New Records: Antonín Barák received the earliest red card ever at the European Championship after 19 minutes and 28 seconds.
Turkey became the first team to receive eight yellow cards in a Euros match, eventually ending with 11 including subs.
There were 18 cards shown between Czech Republic and Turkey in this fixture (16 yellows, two reds); the most in a single game in the tournament’s history.
Key Match Events: Cenk Tosun scored a stoppage-time goal to give Turkey their second victory in Germany.
Antonín Barák was dismissed after being shown two yellow cards in the opening 20 minutes.
Hakan Çalhanoglu gave Turkey the lead early in the second half.
Tomás Soucek equalised for Czech Republic in the 66th minute.
Cenk Tosun scored the winning goal in the fourth minute of stoppage time.
Tomás Chory received a red card after the final whistle for clashing with Arda Güler.
Pre-Game Insights: Exciting youngsters Arda Güler and Kenan Yildiz were back into the starting XI for Turkey.
Mojmír Chytil replaced the injured Patrik Schick up front for the Czechs.
Post-Match Reflections: Turkey advanced to the knockout stages at Euro 2024 while the Czechs were eliminated.
Turkey will play Austria in the round of 16.
Turkey have won each of their last four games against Czech Republic.
Turkey have qualified for the knockout stages of a major tournament for the fourth time in their last six attempts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Turkey struggled to impose themselves in the first half despite having an extra man.
Ferdi Kadioglu created five chances for his teammates in the first half.
Hakan Çalhanoglu scored his first goal at a major tournament.
Hakan Çalhanoglu has made the joint-most European Championship appearances of any Turkish outfield player (8).
Tomás Soucek has scored four goals across his last nine internationals for Czech Republic.
Ferdi Kadioglu created five chances for his teammates against Czech Republic; the joint-most in a European Championship match by a Turkish player.
